programs.name: Python Coding
programs.description: Learn the world's fastest growing and most popular text-based programming language used by actual code developers and computer scientists in a fun project-based manner!

details.description: This course is designed for late primary to secondary aged students who are looking to learn to code using a proper “grown-up” programming language. Learn to code in Python and develop fun games. Python is particularly suitable for this age group because it is concise and easy to read and has multiple applications in the real world (web development, app development and other scientific uses such as data science). This camp is a great introduction to both fundamental programming concepts and the Python programming language. By the end, the students will be comfortable programming in Python and taking their newly acquired programming skills home
take_aways: Use all of the above to make a super cool game

whatYouWillLearn.title: Coding
whatYouWillLearn.description: Learn to code in a fun, familiar environment

whatYouWillLearn.title: Logic
whatYouWillLearn.description: Increased complexity with Loops, Conditions and Variables

whatYouWillLearn.title: Creating Games
whatYouWillLearn.description: Make super awesome games with Python

whatYouWillLearn.title: Discover
whatYouWillLearn.description: Open up a world of possibilities by tinkering your code

whatToBring.title: Lunch
whatToBring.description: All students are expected to bring packed lunch for the day (nut-free and not to be shared).

whatToBring.title: Water
whatToBring.description: In a re-fillable water bottle. No glass or fizzy drinks please.

whatToBring.title: Ready to Learn
whatToBring.description: We expect all children to come in with a great learning attitude.

programs.name: Web Development
programs.description: Dive into the world of web development and learn how to create beautiful and responsive websites using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

details.description: This course is perfect for students who are interested in building and designing websites. They will learn the basics of HTML for structure, CSS for styling, and JavaScript for interactivity. By the end of the course, students will have a fully functional website that they can showcase.
take_aways: Understand the basics of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Add interactivity to web pages using JavaScript
Gain insight into web design and user experience

whatYouWillLearn.title: HTML
whatYouWillLearn.description: Learn to structure web pages with HTML

whatYouWillLearn.title: CSS
whatYouWillLearn.description: Style your web pages using CSS

whatYouWillLearn.title: JavaScript
whatYouWillLearn.description: Add interactivity to your web pages

whatYouWillLearn.title: Web Design
whatYouWillLearn.description: Understand the basics of web design and UX

whatYouWillLearn.title: Project Development
whatYouWillLearn.description: Work on a personal web development project

whatToBring.title: Lunch
whatToBring.description: All students are expected to bring packed lunch for the day (nut-free and not to be shared).

whatToBring.title: Water
whatToBring.description: In a re-fillable water bottle. No glass or fizzy drinks please.

whatToBring.title: Ready to Learn
whatToBring.description: We expect all children to come in with a great learning attitude.

whyChooseUs.title: SUITABLE FOR
details: Interest in web design and development

programs.name: Robotics
programs.description: Explore the exciting world of robotics and learn how to build and program your own robots.

details.description: This course introduces students to the fundamentals of robotics, including building robots using kits and programming them to perform tasks. Students will learn about sensors, motors, and basic electronics, and they will get hands-on experience in assembling and coding robots.
take_aways: Learn to build robots using kits
Participate in a mini robotics competition

whatYouWillLearn.title: Programming
whatYouWillLearn.description: Learn to program robots using block-based coding

whatYouWillLearn.title: Sensors and Motors
whatYouWillLearn.description: Understand how to use sensors and motors in robots

whatYouWillLearn.title: Competition
whatYouWillLearn.description: Participate in a mini robotics competition

whatToBring.title: Lunch
whatToBring.description: All students are expected to bring packed lunch for the day (nut-free and not to be shared).
